instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3332: What is 820-3332? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U8900: What is U8900? This chip creates the GPU power rails on the 820-3332 board to the 2012 and early 2013 15‚Äù Retina Macbook Pros. It becomes desoldered and is the cause of no video and kernel panics/crashes in that model most of the time..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with strange pictures
threads.message:
Have this <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> logic board. What is happening here? 
have tray`d to replace LVDS connector and resloder the <CHIP>U8900</CHIP> but still the same. 

(pictures is taken up/down)

Any one with any idea? 

[USER="2"]dukefawks[/USER] [USER="1"]larossmann[/USER] [USER="682"]2informaticos[/USER]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with strange pictures
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with strange pictures
threads.message: Has nothing to do with <CHIP>U8900</CHIP>. Either really a bad GPU or damaged component in the frame buffer circuit. Check if it still is within 4 years of purchase so you can take it to Apple.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with strange pictures
threads.message:
The board is to nasty/water damage so i dont think thay will touch it.

will look at the buffer circuit.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with strange pictures
threads.message: Oh liquid....Corroded resistor around the VRAM or crap under VRAM or GPU.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with strange pictures
threads.message:
Yeah, sorry that I forgot to mention that in the first post.

If it provides  that the GPU is the problem is the card ready for the donor box?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with strange pictures
threads.message: It will not be the GPU. Traces/corrosion is the issue, the actual chips will be fine.
